00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Cost matrix functions for the asymmetric BTSP.
00003  *
00004  * Cost matrix transformation functions for the asymmetric bottleneck
00005  * traveling salesman problem (SBTSP).
00006  *
00007  * @author  John LaRusic
00008  * @ingroup lib
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "common.h"
00011 #include "btsp.h"

00013 /****************************************************************************
00014  * Private function prototypes
00015  ****************************************************************************/
00016 /**
00017  *  @brief  Retrieves cost between nodes i and j from the function.
00018  *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00019  *  @param  base_problem [in] problem structure
00020  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00021  *  @param  i [in] id of start node
00022  *  @param  j [in] id of end node
00023  *  @return cost between node i and node j
00024  */
00025 int
00026 basic_atsp_get_cost(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00027                     int delta, int i, int j);
00028 
00029 /**
00030  *  @brief  Initializes the function data.
00031  *  @param  fun [out] the function structure to initialize
00032  */
00033 int
00034 basic_atsp_initialize(arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00035               
00036 /**
00037  *  @brief  Destructs the function data.
00038  *  @param  fun [out] the function structure to destruct
00039  */
00040 void
00041 basic_atsp_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00042 
00043 /**
00044  *  @brief  Determines if the given tour is feasible or not.
00045  *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00046  *  @param  problem [in] the problem to check against
00047  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00048  *  @param  tour_length [in] the length of the given tour
00049  *  @param  tour [in] the tour in node-node format
00050  *  @return ARROW_TRUE if the tour is feasible, ARROW_FALSE if not
00051  */
00052 int
00053 basic_atsp_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *problem,
00054                     int delta, double tour_length, int *tour);

00056 
00057 /****************************************************************************
00058  * Public function implementations
00059  ****************************************************************************/
00060 int
00061 arrow_btsp_fun_basic_atsp(int shallow, arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00062 {    
00063     fun->data = NULL;
00064     fun->shallow = shallow;
00065     fun->get_cost = basic_atsp_get_cost;
00066     fun->initialize = basic_atsp_initialize;
00067     fun->destruct = basic_atsp_destruct;
00068     fun->feasible = basic_atsp_feasible;
00069     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00070 }
00071 
00072 
00073 /****************************************************************************
00074  * Private function implementations
00075  ****************************************************************************/
00076 int
00077 basic_atsp_get_cost(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00078                     int delta, int i, int j)
00079 {
00080     int cost = base_problem->get_cost(base_problem, i, j);
00081     
00082     if(cost < 0)
00083         return cost;
00084     else if(cost <= delta)
00085         return 0;
00086     else
00087         return cost;
00088 }
00089 
00090 int
00091 basic_atsp_initialize(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00092 { 
00093     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00094 }
00095 
00096 void
00097 basic_atsp_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00098 { }
00099 
00100 int
00101 basic_atsp_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *problem, 
00102                     int delta, double tour_length, int *tour)
00103 {
00104     int i, u, v, cost;
00105     int trans_edges = 0;
00106     
00107     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00108     {
00109         u = tour[i];
00110         v = tour[(i + 1) % problem->size];
00111         cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00112         
00113         if(cost > delta)
00114             return ARROW_FALSE;
00115            
00116         if(cost < 0)
00117             trans_edges++;
00118     }
00119 
00120     /* If an edge's cost is strictly less than 0, then it was introduced into
00121        the transformation from asymmetric to symmetric.  Any tour we find must
00122        use each of these edges in order for the tour to be valid. */
00123     if(trans_edges == (problem->size / 2))
00124         return ARROW_TRUE;
00125     else
00126         return ARROW_FALSE;
00127 }
